channel.title: Bytecode IRC bot!
channel.description:
Lololol. [URL=http://img175.imageshack.us/my.php?image=irclolzvj4.png][IMG]http://img175.imageshack.us/img175/8729/irclolzvj4.th.png[/img][/URL]
IMO the new thing this community should concentrate on is writing huge Java applications from scratch in bytecode! It's like mega fun to do, and a good way to waste a few years.
To get started writing your own bytecode applications, download [url=http://irregularexpressions.org/CFParse1.3.exe]CFParse[/url], and get writing with the GASM application included. You can disassemble other classes to see how certain code flows work etc.
Myb a fun way to learn some bytecode if you desire to write a Java RuneScape bot.
[code].class public class IRC .super java.lang.Object
.field private static java.net.Socket socket .field private static java.io.InputStream in .field private static java.io.OutputStream out .field private static java.io.BufferedReader reader .field private static byte[] NEWLINE .field private static java.lang.String SERVER
.method public static void main(java.lang.String[]) .limit stack 3 .limit locals 1 bipush #2 newarray T_BYTE dup putstatic byte[] IRC.NEWLINE iconst_0 bipush #13 bastore getstatic byte[] IRC.NEWLINE iconst_1 bipush #10 bastore ldc "irc.mmoirc.com" putstatic java.lang.String IRC.SERVER invokestatic void IRC.connect() return .end method
.method private static void connect() .limit stack 4 .limit locals 2 new java.net.Socket dup getstatic java.lang.String IRC.SERVER sipush #6667 invokespecial void java.net.Socket.<init>(java.lang.String,int) putstatic java.net.Socket IRC.socket getstatic java.net.Socket IRC.socket dup invokevirtual java.io.InputStream java.net.Socket.getInputStream() putstatic java.io.InputStream IRC.in invokevirtual java.io.OutputStream java.net.Socket.getOutputStream() putstatic java.io.OutputStream IRC.out new java.io.InputStreamReader dup getstatic java.io.InputStream IRC.in invokespecial void java.io.InputStreamReader.<init>(java.io.InputStream) astore v1 new java.io.BufferedReader dup aload v1 invokespecial void java.io.BufferedReader.<init>(java.io.Reader) putstatic java.io.BufferedReader IRC.reader ldc "hostname" invokestatic void IRC.readModalUntil(java.lang.String) ldc "USER bcBot bcBot bcBot bcBot bcBot" invokestatic void IRC.writeSocket(java.lang.String) ldc "NICK bcBot" invokestatic void IRC.writeSocket(java.lang.String) invokestatic java.lang.String IRC.readSocket() pop ldc "MODE" invokestatic void IRC.readModalUntil(java.lang.String) ldc "JOIN #test" invokestatic void IRC.writeSocket(java.lang.String) invokestatic void IRC.loopIRC() return .end method
.method private static void loopIRC() .limit stack 2 .limit locals 1 TAG_0: getstatic java.net.Socket IRC.socket invokevirtual boolean java.net.Socket.isConnected() ifeq TAG_1 invokestatic java.lang.String IRC.readSocket() ldc "PRIVMSG #test :!hello" invokevirtual boolean java.lang.String.contains(java.lang.CharSequence) ifeq TAG_2 ldc "PRIVMSG #test :Why hello there!" invokestatic void IRC.writeSocket(java.lang.String) TAG_2: goto TAG_0 TAG_1: return .end method
.method private static void writeSocket(java.lang.String) .limit stack 4 .limit locals 2 getstatic java.io.OutputStream IRC.out dup dup aload v0 invokevirtual byte[] java.lang.String.getBytes() invokevirtual void java.io.OutputStream.write(byte[]) getstatic byte[] IRC.NEWLINE invokevirtual void java.io.OutputStream.write(byte[]) getstatic java.io.PrintStream java.lang.System.out dup ldc "->" invokevirtual void java.io.PrintStream.print(java.lang.String) aload v0 invokevirtual void java.io.PrintStream.println(java.lang.String) return .end method
.method private static java.lang.String readSocket() .limit stack 4 .limit locals 1 getstatic java.io.BufferedReader IRC.reader invokevirtual java.lang.String java.io.BufferedReader.readLine() astore v0 getstatic java.io.PrintStream java.lang.System.out dup ldc "<-" invokevirtual void java.io.PrintStream.print(java.lang.String) aload v0 invokevirtual void java.io.PrintStream.println(java.lang.String) aload v0 areturn .end method
.method private static void readModalUntil(java.lang.String) .limit stack 3 .limit locals 3 iconst_0 istore v1 TAG_0: invokestatic java.lang.String IRC.readSocket() aload v0 invokevirtual boolean java.lang.String.contains(java.lang.CharSequence) dup istore v1 ifeq TAG_0 return .end method
.end class[/code]

item.title: Bytecode IRC bot!
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

…someone has too much time

Although I guess it’s great for learning bytecode as a beginner rather than just jumping in at the deepend with RS bots.

Read full topic

item.title: Bytecode IRC bot!
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

Lololol.

IMO the new thing this community should concentrate on is writing huge Java applications from scratch in bytecode! It’s like mega fun to do, and a good way to waste a few years.

To get started writing your own bytecode applications, download CFParse, and get writing with the GASM application included. You can disassemble other classes to see how certain code flows work etc.

Myb a fun way to learn some bytecode if you desire to write a Java RuneScape bot.

[code].class public class IRC
.super java.lang.Object

.field private static java.net.Socket socket
.field private static java.io.InputStream in
.field private static java.io.OutputStream out
.field private static java.io.BufferedReader reader
.field private static byte[] NEWLINE
.field private static java.lang.String SERVER

.method public static void main(java.lang.String[])
.limit stack 3
.limit locals 1
bipush #2
newarray T_BYTE
dup
putstatic byte[] IRC.NEWLINE
iconst_0
bipush #13
bastore
getstatic byte[] IRC.NEWLINE
iconst_1
bipush #10
bastore
ldc “irc.mmoirc.com”
putstatic java.lang.String IRC.SERVER
invokestatic void IRC.connect()
return
.end method

.method private static void connect()
.limit stack 4
.limit locals 2
new java.net.Socket
dup
getstatic java.lang.String IRC.SERVER
sipush #6667
invokespecial void java.net.Socket.(java.lang.String,int)
putstatic java.net.Socket IRC.socket
getstatic java.net.Socket IRC.socket
dup
invokevirtual java.io.InputStream java.net.Socket.getInputStream()
putstatic java.io.InputStream IRC.in
invokevirtual java.io.OutputStream java.net.Socket.getOutputStream()
putstatic java.io.OutputStream IRC.out
new java.io.InputStreamReader
dup
getstatic java.io.InputStream IRC.in
invokespecial void java.io.InputStreamReader.(java.io.InputStream)
astore v1
new java.io.BufferedReader
dup
aload v1
invokespecial void java.io.BufferedReader.(java.io.Reader)
putstatic java.io.BufferedReader IRC.reader
ldc “hostname”
invokestatic void IRC.readModalUntil(java.lang.String)
ldc “USER bcBot bcBot bcBot bcBot bcBot”
invokestatic void IRC.writeSocket(java.lang.String)
ldc “NICK bcBot”
invokestatic void IRC.writeSocket(java.lang.String)
invokestatic java.lang.String IRC.readSocket()
pop
ldc “MODE”
invokestatic void IRC.readModalUntil(java.lang.String)
ldc “JOIN #test”
invokestatic void IRC.writeSocket(java.lang.String)
invokestatic void IRC.loopIRC()
return
.end method

.method private static void loopIRC()
.limit stack 2
.limit locals 1
TAG_0: getstatic java.net.Socket IRC.socket
invokevirtual boolean java.net.Socket.isConnected()
ifeq TAG_1
invokestatic java.lang.String IRC.readSocket()
ldc “PRIVMSG #test :!hello”
invokevirtual boolean java.lang.String.contains(java.lang.CharSequence)
ifeq TAG_2
ldc “PRIVMSG #test :Why hello there!”
invokestatic void IRC.writeSocket(java.lang.String)
TAG_2: goto TAG_0
TAG_1: return
.end method

.method private static void writeSocket(java.lang.String)
.limit stack 4
.limit locals 2
getstatic java.io.OutputStream IRC.out
dup
dup
aload v0
invokevirtual byte[] java.lang.String.getBytes()
invokevirtual void java.io.OutputStream.write(byte[])
getstatic byte[] IRC.NEWLINE
invokevirtual void java.io.OutputStream.write(byte[])
getstatic java.io.PrintStream java.lang.System.out
dup
ldc “->”
invokevirtual void java.io.PrintStream.print(java.lang.String)
aload v0
invokevirtual void java.io.PrintStream.println(java.lang.String)
return
.end method

.method private static java.lang.String readSocket()
.limit stack 4
.limit locals 1
getstatic java.io.BufferedReader IRC.reader
invokevirtual java.lang.String java.io.BufferedReader.readLine()
astore v0
getstatic java.io.PrintStream java.lang.System.out
dup
ldc “<-”
invokevirtual void java.io.PrintStream.print(java.lang.String)
aload v0
invokevirtual void java.io.PrintStream.println(java.lang.String)
aload v0
areturn
.end method

.method private static void readModalUntil(java.lang.String)
.limit stack 3
.limit locals 3
iconst_0
istore v1
TAG_0: invokestatic java.lang.String IRC.readSocket()
aload v0
invokevirtual boolean java.lang.String.contains(java.lang.CharSequence)
dup
istore v1
ifeq TAG_0
return
.end method

.end class[/code]
